creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: long red petal shaped form with top edges curving inward; horizontally oriented
text: The title of Tanaka’s Tactile Memory series alludes to the feeling experienced when touching a lacquered surface. The delicate, round, red form of this work from the series compellingly suggests flower petals. He formed a mold of the sculpture from Styrofoam, which he discarded after gluing together many layers of hemp cloth with lacquer.
title: The Tactile Memory: Floral Impression (2011-II)
